p.note: The following procedure will remove from your system. All data stored in the installation directory will be removed, including any customizations or any other data you have stored within that directory. Make a backup of any data you want to keep before proceeding.

ol.li: Back up any data you want to keep from the installation folder.

Remove the application according to your operating system:
Windows or Linux - Use the appropriate uninstaller shortcut provided with your OS.
OS X - Manually delete the installation folder and all its contents.

If you want to remove the user preferences:
Windows - Remove the directory: %APPDATA%\Roaming\com.oxygenxml%APPDATA%\Roaming\com.oxygenxml.author%APPDATA%\Roaming\com.oxygenxml.developer%APPDATA%\Roaming\com.syncrosvnClient (usually %APPDATA% has the value: [user-home-dir]\Application Data). Note that this directory is hidden.
OS X - Remove the directory: Library/Preferences/com.oxygenxmlLibrary/Preferences/com.oxygenxml.authorLibrary/Preferences/com.oxygenxml.developer Library/Preferences/com.syncrosvnClient of the user home folder.
On Linux, remove the directory: .com.oxygenxml.com.oxygenxml.author.com.oxygenxml.developer.com.syncrosvnClient from the user home directory.

section.title: Unattended Uninstall
section.p: The unattended uninstall procedure is available only on Windows and Linux.

Run the uninstaller executable from command line with the -q parameter.
Windows - The uninstaller executable is called uninstall.exe and is located in the Oxygen installation directory.
Linux - The uninstaller executable is called uninstall and is located in the Oxygen installation directory.

p.note: The following procedure will remove from your system. It will not remove the Eclipse platform. If you want to uninstall Eclipse, refer to its uninstall instructions.

ol.li: Choose the menu option Help About Installation Details .
Select from the list of plugins.

If you want to remove the user preferences:
Windows - Remove the directory: %APPDATA%\com.oxygenxml%APPDATA%\com.oxygenxml.author%APPDATA%\com.oxygenxml.developer (usually %APPDATA% has the value: [user-home-dir]\Application Data). Note that this directory is hidden.
OS X - Remove the directory: Library/Preferences/com.oxygenxmlLibrary/Preferences/com.oxygenxml.authorLibrary/Preferences/com.oxygenxml.developer of the user home folder.
On Linux, remove the directory: .com.oxygenxml.com.oxygenxml.author.com.oxygenxml.developer from the user home directory.
